identificationModule.officialTitle: Sexual Health and Rehabilitation Online (SHAREonline): An Educational Intervention for Young Adult Women After Cancer

descriptionModule.briefSummary:
SHAREonline is a study for young female cancer survivors that are experiencing changes in sexual health and function.

The purpose of this research is to compare two brief interventions delivered by videoconference to learn if they help women effectively manage these changes and restore sexual health and functioning.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
The purpose of this research is to compare two brief interventions delivered by videoconference to learn if they help women effectively manage these changes and restore sexual health and functioning.

Participants in this study would first complete health questionnaires and then be randomized to take part in one of two types of education sessions delivered by an instructor over videoconference: 1) Group education session or 2) Individual self-management session.

About 56 women will receive the group education session and about 28 will receive the individual self-management session.

It is expected that about 84 women will take part in this study.

armGroups.label: SHAREonline
armGroups.description:
Participants will receive:

* One online group session structured around three 60-minute modules and creation of a personal action plan
* Single Coaching phone call at one month
* Questionnaires to complete at baseline, 2 and 4 Months

armGroups.label: Individual Self Management
armGroups.description:
Brief individualized session with online and written materials and guidance.

All Participants will complete study questionnaires at baseline, 2 months and 4 months post intervention

interventions.name: Group Session
interventions.description: On-line educational session-3 modules-1 hour each for a total of 3 hours

interventions.name: Coaching Call
interventions.description: Single Coaching phone call at one month

interventions.name: Educational Materials
interventions.description: Individual videoconference session in which participants will receive a pdf of the American Cancer Society booklet, 'Sex and the Adult Female with Cancer

primaryOutcomes.description: The Female Sexual Function Index (FSFI Full Scale Score), is 19-item instrument which measures sexual function, including desire, orgasm, pain and satisfaction.

secondaryOutcomes.description: BSI-18 (Brief Symptom Inventory) The BSI-18 is a well-validated screening measure of psychological distress with subscales measuring anxiety, depression and somatization that is frequently used with oncology populations.
The Female Sexual Function Index (FSFI Full Scale Score), is 19-item instrument which measures sexual function, including desire, orgasm, pain and satisfaction.

BSI-18 (Brief Symptom Inventory) The BSI-18 is a well-validated screening measure of psychological distress with subscales measuring anxiety, depression and somatization that is frequently used with oncology populations.
Measured through study accrual with a benchmark of enrollment greater than or equal to 40% of eligible candidates
Intervention Satisfaction Questionnaire will be assessed using a benchmark mean score of 4
Measured through study engagement with a benchmark of study engagement greater than or equal to 70% of eligible candidates
Measured through intervention completion with a benchmark of intervention completion greater than or equal to 60% of eligible candidates
Sexual Distress Scale-short form (SDS-SF) is a 5-item measure which assesses distress about sexual function.
Sexual Distress Scale-short form (SDS-SF) is a 5-item measure which assesses distress about sexual function.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Sexual Function, Satisfaction and Sexual Inactivity
secondaryOutcomes.description: PROMIS Sexual Function and Satisfaction (PROMIS SexFS) is a short screening

otherOutcomes.description: Sexual Self-Efficacy Scale is a 5-item scale developed to measure perceived sexual self-efficacy to address sexual health after cancer.
Sexual Self-Efficacy Scale is a 5-item scale developed to measure perceived sexual self-efficacy to address sexual health after cancer.
Brief participant questionnaire to provide feedback about coaching session.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
* Female cancer survivors age 19-49
* Cancer diagnosis (except non-melanoma skin cancer) ≥ 1 year prior
* Diagnosed with first cancer ≥ age 18
* No active cancer therapy (excluding chemoprevention) in the past four months, and no further therapy planned
* Ability to read and write in English
* Bothered by significant sexual dysfunction as evidenced by a Female Sexual Functioning Index (FSFI) score of ≤26.
* Regular access to the internet

Exclusion Criteria

* Has never been sexually active
* Any impairment (e.g., hearing, visual, cognitive) that interferes with the ability to complete all study procedures independently

ipdSharingStatementModule.description: The Dana-Farber / Harvard Cancer Center encourages and supports the responsible and ethical sharing of data from clinical trials. De-identified participant data from the final research dataset used in the published manuscript may only be shared under the terms of a Data Use Agreement. Requests may be directed to: \[contact information for Sponsor Investigator or designee\]. The protocol and statistical analysis plan will be made available on Clinicaltrials.gov only as required by federal regulation or as a condition of awards and agreements supporting the research.
ipdSharingStatementModule.timeFrame: Data can be shared no earlier than 1 year following the date of publication
ipdSharingStatementModule.accessCriteria: Contact the Belfer Office for Dana-Farber Innovations (BODFI) at innovation@dfci.harvard.edu
